title: Sebastian Hanika
text: I am a PhD student in Human Geography at Lund University, specializing in the intersection between Human Geography and demography. My research focuses on spatial variations in population aging and the labor market participation of older workers. I have a strong interest in quantitative methods, particularly R programming and GIS.

title: Sebastian Hanika
text:
Education
Ph.D. in Human Geography Lund University, Sweden September 2022 - now
M.Sc. in Demography Universitat Autònoma de Barcelona, Spain Euorepan Doctoral School of Dempgraphy September 2021 - July 20222
M.Sc. in Human Geography Copenhagen University, Denmark September 2019 - June 2021
B.Sc. Geography and Economics Humboldt Universty Berlin, Germany September 2015 - June 2019

title: research
text: My research interest are sustainability transitions. In my PhD project, I investigate the directionality of transitioning to bioeconomies.

title: Teaching
text: I began teaching at the university level in March 2023. Moving forward, my goal is to create more interactive materials and exercises for teaching quantitative methods. Additionally, I have plans to deliver guest lectures in population or economic geography, aligning with my research interests.

title: Teaching
text:
Courses

Applied methods in planning
I taught the module on Quantitative Methods and Statistics, which encompassed lectures, seminars, and lab exercises. Throughout the course, I delivered a total of 12 hours of in-classroom teaching. I also had responsibility for grading assignments and assessments.

title: Teaching
text:
Supervision

Degree project in Human Geography
I supervised two students for their degree projects in Human Geography as part of the SGEA23 course.
